ai-an10:55.2.1_0: “Reverends, they speak of a person liable to decline,
ai-an10:55.2.2_0: and one not liable to decline.
ai-an10:55.2.3_0: How did the Buddha define a person liable to decline? How did he define a person who doesn’t decline?”
ai-an10:55.2.4_0: “Reverend, we would travel a long way to learn the meaning of this statement in the presence of Venerable Sāriputta.
ai-an10:55.2.6_0: The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-an10:55.3.1_0: “Well then, reverends, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an10:55.4.1_0: “How did the Buddha define a person liable to decline?
ai-an10:55.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t get to hear a teaching they haven’t heard before. They forget those teachings they have heard. They don’t keep rehearsing the teachings they’ve already got to know. And they don’t come to understand what they haven’t understood before.
ai-an10:55.4.3_0: That’s how the Buddha defined a person liable to decline.
ai-an10:55.5.1_0: And how did the Buddha define a person not liable to decline?
ai-an10:55.5.2_0: It’s when a mendicant gets to hear a teaching they haven’t heard before. They forget those teachings they have heard. They forget those teachings they haven’t understood before. And they come to understand what they haven’t understood before.
ai-an10:55.5.3_0: That’s how the Buddha defined a person not liable to decline.
ai-an10:55.6.1_0: If a mendicant isn’t skilled in the ways of another’s mind, then they should train themselves: ‘I will be skilled in the ways of my own mind.’
ai-an10:55.7.1_0: And how is a mendicant skilled in pairs?
ai-an10:55.7.2_0: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and they check their own reflection in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.
ai-an10:55.7.3_0: If they see any dirt, they’re happy in that place.
ai-an10:55.7.5_0: In the same way, checking is very helpful for a mendicant’s skillful qualities.
ai-an10:55.7.6_0: ‘Is contentment often found in me or not? Is kind-heartedness often found in me or not? Is freedom from dullness and drowsiness often found in me or not? Is calm often found in me or not? Is confidence often found in me or not? Is love often found in me or not? Is purity of mind often found in me or not? Is internal joy with the teaching found in me or not? Is internal serenity of heart found in me or not? Is the higher wisdom of discernment of principles found in me or not?’
ai-an10:55.8.1_0: But suppose that, while checking, a mendicant sees all these skillful qualities in themselves, they should apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:55.8.2_0: Suppose your clothes or head were on fire. In order to extinguish it, you’d apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:55.8.3_0: If that head were on fire, we’d apply intense enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:55.8.4_0: In the same way, they should apply outstanding enthusiasm to get those skillful qualities ...
ai-an10:55.9.1_0: Suppose a mendicant, while checking, sees some of these skillful qualities in themselves, but doesn’t see others. Grounded on the skillful qualities they see, they should apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness in order to get the skillful qualities they don’t see.
ai-an10:55.9.2_0: Suppose your clothes or head were on fire. In order to extinguish it, you’d apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:55.9.3_0: If that head were on fire, we’d apply intense enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
ai-an10:55.9.4_0: In the same way, a mendicant sees that they haven’t seen, heard, thought, known, attained, so exert in order to get those skillful qualities.
ai-an10:55.10.1_0: But suppose a mendicant, while checking, sees all of these skillful qualities in themselves. Grounded on all these skillful qualities they should practice meditation further to end the defilements.”
ai-an10:56.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these ten perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.
ai-an10:56.1.3_0: The perceptions of ugliness, death, repulsiveness of food, dissatisfaction with the whole world, impermanence, suffering in impermanence, not-self in suffering, giving up, fading away, and cessation.
ai-an10:56.1.4_0: These ten perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.”
ai-an10:56.1.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an10:57.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these ten perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.
ai-an10:57.1.3_0: The perceptions of impermanence, not-self, death, repulsiveness of food, dissatisfaction with the whole world, a skeleton, a worm-infested corpse, a livid corpse, a split open corpse, and a bloated corpse.
ai-an10:57.1.4_0: These ten perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.”
ai-an10:58.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if wanderers who follow other paths were to ask:
ai-an10:58.1.2_0: ‘Reverends, all things have what as their root? What produces them? What is their origin? What is their meeting place? What is their chief? What is their ruler? What is their overseer? What is their core? What is their culmination? What is their final end?’ How would you answer them?”
ai-an10:58.1.3_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha.
ai-an10:58.1.3_1: He is our guide and our refuge.
ai-an10:58.1.3_2: The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-an10:58.2.1_0: “Well then, mendicants, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an10:58.3.1_0: “Mendicants, if wanderers who follow other paths were to ask:
ai-an10:58.3.2_0: ‘Reverends, all things have what as their root? What produces them? What is their origin? What is their meeting place? What is their chief? What is their ruler? What is their overseer? What is their core? What is their culmination? What is their final end?’
ai-an10:58.3.4_0: ‘Reverends, all things are rooted in desire. Attention produces them. Contact is their origin. Feeling is their meeting place. Immersion is their chief. Mindfulness is their ruler. Wisdom is their overseer. Freedom is their core. They culminate in the deathless. And extinguishment is their final end.’
ai-an10:58.3.5_0: When questioned by wanderers who follow other paths, that’s how you should answer them.”
ai-an10:59.1.2_0: ‘Our minds will be consolidated as they were when we went forth, and arisen bad unskillful qualities will not occupy our minds.
ai-an10:59.2.1_0: When your minds are consolidated in these ten perceptions, you can expect one of two results:
ai-an10:59.2.2_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
ai-an10:60.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:60.1.2_0: Now at that time Venerable Girimānanda was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
ai-an10:60.1.3_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:60.1.3_2: After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
ai-an10:60.2.1_0: “Reverend Sir, venerable Girimānanda is afflicted, suffering, and very sick.
ai-an10:60.2.2_0: Sir, please go to Venerable Girimānanda out of compassion.”
ai-an10:60.2.3_0: “Ānanda, if you were to recite to the mendicant Girimānanda these ten perceptions, it’s possible that after hearing them his illness will die down on the spot.
ai-an10:60.3.2_0: The perceptions of impermanence, not-self, ugliness, drawbacks, giving up, fading away, cessation, dissatisfaction with the whole world, impermanence of all conditions, and mindfulness of breathing.
ai-an10:60.4.1_0: And what is the perception of impermanence?
ai-an10:60.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.4.3_0: ‘Form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are impermanent.’
ai-an10:60.4.4_0: And so they meditate observing impermanence in the five grasping aggregates.
ai-an10:60.4.5_0: This is called the perception of impermanence.
ai-an10:60.5.1_0: And what is the perception of not-self?
ai-an10:60.5.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.5.3_0: ‘The eye and sights, ear and sounds, nose and smells, tongue and tastes, body and touches, and mind and thoughts are not-self.’
ai-an10:60.5.4_0: And so they meditate observing not-self in the six interior and exterior sense fields.
ai-an10:60.5.5_0: This is called the perception of not-self.
ai-an10:60.6.1_0: And what is the perception of ugliness?
ai-an10:60.6.2_0: It’s when a mendicant examines their own body up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-an10:60.6.3_0: ‘In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.’
ai-an10:60.6.4_0: And so they meditate observing ugliness in this body.
ai-an10:60.6.5_0: This is called the perception of ugliness.
ai-an10:60.7.1_0: And what is the perception of drawbacks?
ai-an10:60.7.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.7.3_0: ‘This body has much suffering and many drawbacks, such as
ai-an10:60.7.4_0: Diseases of the eye, inner ear, nose, tongue, body, head, outer ear, mouth, teeth, and lips. Cough, asthma, catarrh, inflammation, fever, stomach ache, fainting, dysentery, gastric pain, cholera, leprosy, boils, eczema, tuberculosis, epilepsy, herpes, itch, scabs, smallpox, scabies, hemorrhage, diabetes, pimples, pimples, and ulcers. Afflictions stemming from disorders of bile, phlegm, wind, or their conjunction. Afflictions caused by change in weather, by not taking care of yourself, by overexertion, or as the result
ai-an10:60.7.5_0: Thus, in regard to this body, he dwells contemplating danger.
ai-an10:60.7.6_0: This is called the perception of drawbacks.
ai-an10:60.8.1_0: And what is the perception of giving up?
ai-an10:60.8.2_0: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t tolerate a sensual,
ai-an10:60.8.2_1: They don’t tolerate a malicious, or cruel thought that has arisen.
ai-an10:60.8.2_2: They don’t tolerate any bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen, but give them up, get rid of them, eliminate them, and obliterate them.
ai-an10:60.8.2_3: They don’t tolerate any bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen, but give them up, get rid of them, eliminate them, and obliterate them.
ai-an10:60.8.3_0: This is called the perception of giving up.
ai-an10:60.9.1_0: And what is the perception of dispassion?
ai-an10:60.9.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.9.3_0: ‘This is peaceful; this is sublime—that is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, extinguishment.’
ai-an10:60.9.4_0: This is called the perception of fading away.
ai-an10:60.10.1_0: And what is the perception of cessation?
ai-an10:60.10.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-an10:60.10.3_0: ‘This is peaceful; this is sublime—that is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.’
ai-an10:60.10.4_0: This is called the perception of cessation.
ai-an10:60.11.1_0: And what is the perception of dissatisfaction with the whole world?
ai-an10:60.11.2_0: It’s when a mendicant lives giving up and not grasping on to the attraction and grasping to the world, the mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies.
ai-an10:60.11.3_0: This is called the perception of dissatisfaction with the whole world.
ai-an10:60.12.1_0: And what is the perception of the impermanence of all conditions?
ai-an10:60.12.2_0: It’s when a mendicant is horrified, repelled, and disgusted with all conditions.
ai-an10:60.12.3_0: This is called the perception of the impermanence of all conditions.
ai-an10:60.13.1_0: And what is mindfulness of breathing?
ai-an10:60.13.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there.
ai-an10:60.13.3_0: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out.
ai-an10:60.13.4_0: When breathing in heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing in heavily.’
ai-an10:60.13.5_1: or, when breathing out short, he knows: ‘I am breathing out short.’
ai-an10:60.13.6_0: They practice breathing in experiencing the whole body. They practice breathing out experiencing the whole body.
ai-an10:60.13.7_0: They practice breathing in stilling the body’s motion.
ai-an10:60.13.7_1: They practice breathing out stilling the body’s motion.
ai-an10:60.13.8_0: They practice breathing in experiencing rapture. They practice breathing out experiencing rapture.
ai-an10:60.13.10_0: They practice breathing in experiencing these emotions.
ai-an10:60.13.10_1: They practice breathing out experiencing these emotions.
ai-an10:60.13.11_0: They practice breathing in stilling these emotions.

ai-an10:63.1.1_0: “Mendicants, those who have come to a conclusion about me are accomplished in view.
ai-an10:63.1.2_0: Of those who are accomplished in view, five conclude their path in this realm, and five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.
ai-an10:63.1.3_0: Which five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind?
ai-an10:63.1.4_0: The one who has seven rebirths at most, the one who goes from family to family, the one-seeder, the once returner, and the one who is perfected in the present life.
ai-an10:63.1.5_0: These five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.
ai-an10:63.1.6_0: Which five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind?
ai-an10:63.1.7_0: The one who is extinguished between one life and the next, the one who is extinguished upon landing, the one who is extinguished without extra effort, the one who is extinguished with extra effort, and the one who heads upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.
ai-an10:63.1.8_0: These five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.
ai-an10:63.1.9_0: All those who have come to a conclusion about me are accomplished in view.
ai-an10:63.1.10_0: Of those who are accomplished in view, these five conclude their path in this realm, and these five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.”

ai-an10:65.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans near the little village of Nālaka.
ai-an10:65.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍakāni went to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-an10:65.1.2_1: and after going, he exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an10:65.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an10:65.2.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, what is happiness and what is suffering?”
ai-an10:65.2.2_0: “Rebirth is suffering, reverend, no rebirth is happiness.
ai-an10:65.2.3_0: When there is rebirth, you can expect this kind of suffering.
ai-an10:65.2.4_0: Cold, heat, hunger, thirst, defecation, and urination. Contact with fire, clubs, and knives. And relatives and friends get together and annoy you.
ai-an10:65.2.5_0: When there is rebirth, this is the kind of suffering you can expect.
ai-an10:65.2.6_0: When there is no rebirth, you can expect this kind of happiness.
ai-an10:65.2.7_0: Cold, heat, hunger, thirst, defecation, and urination. Nor do they make sure that.
ai-an10:65.2.8_0: When there is no rebirth, this is the kind of happiness you can expect.”
ai-an10:66.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans near the little village of Nālaka.

ai-an10:67.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a town of the Kosalans named Naḷaka.
ai-an10:67.1.2_0: There the Buddha stayed near Naḷakapāna in the parrot tree grove.
ai-an10:67.1.3_0: On one occasion on the observance day, he was seated surrounded by the Sangha of monks.
ai-an10:67.1.4_0: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk. Then he looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed Venerable Sāriputta:
ai-an10:67.2.1_0: “Sāriputta, the Saṅgha of mendicants is rid of dullness and drowsiness.
ai-an10:67.2.2_0: Give them some Dhamma talk as you feel inspired.
ai-an10:67.3.1_0: And then the Buddha spread out his outer robe folded in four and laid down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.
ai-an10:67.4.1_0: “Reverends, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.4.4_0: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.4.5_0: It’s like the moon in the waning fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only decline.
ai-an10:67.4.6_0: In the same way, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.4.9_0: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.5.1_0: A faithless individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.2_0: An individual with no conscience is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.3_0: An imprudent individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.4_0: An lazy individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.5_0: A witless individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.6_0: An irritable individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.7_0: A hostile individual is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.8_0: An individual with bad desires is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.9_0: An individual with bad friends is in decline.
ai-an10:67.5.10_0: An individual with wrong view is in decline.

ai-an10:67.6.3_0: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.6.4_0: It’s like the moon in the waxing fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only grow.
ai-an10:67.6.5_0: In the same way, whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.6.8_0: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an10:67.7.2_0: An individual with a conscience doesn’t decline.
ai-an10:67.7.8_0: An individual with few desires doesn’t decline.
ai-an10:67.7.9_0: An individual with good friends doesn’t decline.
ai-an10:67.7.10_0: An individual with right view doesn’t decline.”
ai-an10:67.8.1_0: Then the Buddha got up and said to Venerable Sāriputta:
ai-an10:67.8.3_0: Whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities
ai-an10:67.8.6_0: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

ai-an10:67.9.1_0: A faithless individual is in decline.

ai-an10:69.2.1_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.

ai-an10:69.3.4_0: talk about kings, bandits, and ministers; talk about armies, threats, and wars; talk about food, drink, clothes, and beds; talk about garlands and fragrances; talk about family, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, and countries; talk about women and heroes; street talk and well talk; talk about the departed; motley talk; tales of land and sea; and talk about being reborn in this or that state of existence.
ai-an10:69.4.1_0: There are these ten bases for talk, monks.
ai-an10:69.4.3_0: Talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an10:69.4.4_0: These are the ten topics of discussion.

ai-an10:72.6.3_0: Relishing company is a thorn for someone who loves seclusion. Focusing on the beautiful feature of things is a thorn for someone pursuing the meditation on ugliness. ai-an10:77.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a crow has ten bad qualities.
ai-an10:77.1.3_0: They’re rude and impudent, gluttonous and voracious, cruel and pitiless, weak and raucous, unmindful and acquisitive.
ai-an10:77.1.4_0: A crow has these ten bad qualities.
ai-an10:77.1.5_0: In the same way, a bad mendicant has these ten bad qualities.
ai-an10:77.1.7_0: They’re rude and impudent, gluttonous and voracious, cruel and pitiless, weak and raucous, unmindful and acquisitive.
ai-an10:77.1.8_0: A bad mendicant has these ten bad qualities.”
ai-an10:78.1.1_0: “Mendicants, Jain ascetics have ten bad qualities.
ai-an10:78.1.8_0: They glorify themselves and put others down.
ai-an10:78.1.9_0: They’re attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go.
ai-an10:78.1.13_0: Jain ascetics have these ten bad qualities.”
ai-an10:79.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ten grounds for resentment.
ai-an10:79.1.3_0: Thinking: ‘They did wrong to me,’ you harbor resentment.
ai-an10:79.1.4_0: Thinking: ‘They are doing wrong to me’ ...
ai-an10:79.1.6_0: ‘They did wrong by someone I love’ ...
ai-an10:79.1.7_0: ‘They are doing wrong by someone I love’ ...
ai-an10:79.1.8_0: ‘They will do wrong to someone I love’ ...
ai-an10:79.1.11_0: Thinking: ‘They will help someone I dislike,’ you harbor resentment.
ai-an10:79.1.12_0: And you get angry for no reason.
ai-an10:79.1.13_0: These are the ten grounds for resentment.”
ai-an10:80.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these ten methods to get rid of resentment.
ai-an10:80.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:80.1.3_0: Thinking: ‘They did wrong to me, but what can I possibly do?’ you get rid of resentment.
ai-an10:80.1.4_0: Thinking: ‘They are doing wrong to me ...’ ...
ai-an10:80.1.10_0: Thinking: ‘They will help someone I dislike, but what can I possibly do?’ you get rid of resentment.
ai-an10:80.1.11_0: And you don’t get angry for no reason.
ai-an10:80.1.12_0: These are the ten methods to get rid of resentment.”

ai-an10:81.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā Lotus Pond.
ai-an10:81.1.2_0: Then venerable Bāhuna went to the Fortunate One,
ai-an10:81.1.2_2: While sitting on one side venerable Bāhuna said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an10:81.1.3_0: “Sir, how many things has the Realized One escaped from, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits?”
ai-an10:81.2.1_0: “Bāhuna, the Realized One has escaped from ten things, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits.
ai-an10:81.2.3_0: The Realized One has escaped from form, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits.
ai-an10:81.2.13_0: Suppose there was a blue water lily, or a pink or white lotus. Though it sprouted and grew in the water, it would rise up above the water and stand with no water cling to it.
ai-an10:81.2.14_0: In the same way, the Realized One has escaped from ten things, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits.”
ai-an10:82.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an10:82.2.1_0: “Ānanda, it’s not possible for a faithless mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:82.3.1_0: It’s not possible for a mendicant who is unethical ...
ai-an10:82.7.1_0: It’s not possible for a mendicant who is ethical ...
ai-an10:82.11.1_0: of wrong view to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:82.12.1_0: It’s not possible for a mendicant with these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:82.14.1_0: It is possible for a mendicant who is ethical ...
ai-an10:82.22.1_0: of right view to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-an10:82.23.1_0: It is possible for a mendicant with these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”
ai-an10:83.1.1_0: Then venerable Puṇṇiya went to the Fortunate One,
ai-an10:83.1.1_2: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha,
ai-an10:83.1.2_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes the Realized One feels inspired to teach, and other times not?”
ai-an10:83.2.1_0: “Puṇṇiya, when a mendicant has faith but doesn’t approach, the Realized One doesn’t feel inspired to teach.
ai-an10:83.2.2_0: But when a mendicant has faith and approaches, the Realized One feels inspired to teach.
ai-an10:83.3.1_0: A mendicant is faithful, but doesn’t pay homage to him. ...
ai-an10:83.3.2_0: they pay homage, but don’t ask questions ...
ai-an10:83.3.3_0: they ask questions, but don’t lend an ear ...
ai-an10:83.3.4_0: they lend an ear, but don’t remember the teaching they’ve heard ...
ai-an10:83.3.5_0: they don’t remember the teachings they’ve heard ...
ai-an10:83.3.6_0: they reflect on the meaning of the teachings they’ve remembered, but, having understood the meaning and the teaching, they don’t practice accordingly ...
ai-an10:83.3.7_0: Understanding the meaning and the teaching, they practice accordingly. ...
ai-an10:83.3.8_0: They’re a good speaker, but they don’t educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire their spiritual companions. The Realized One doesn’t feel inspired to teach.
ai-an10:83.4.1_0: But when a mendicant has faith, approaches, pays homage, asks questions, lends an ear, remembers the teachings, reflects on the meaning, practices accordingly, has a good voice, and encourages their spiritual companions,
ai-an10:83.4.2_0: the Realized One feels inspired to teach.
ai-an10:83.4.3_0: When someone has these ten qualities, the Realized One feels totally inspired to teach.”
ai-an10:84.1.1_0: There Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed the mendicants:
ai-an10:84.2.2_0: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-an10:84.2.3_0: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples ...
ai-an10:84.2.4_0: Grilled in this way they get stuck or lose their way. They fall to ruin and disaster.

ai-an10:84.3.2_0: ‘Why does this venerable declare enlightenment, saying:
ai-an10:84.3.3_0: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”’

ai-an10:84.15.2_0: It is possible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training after giving up these ten qualities.”

ai-an10:91.22.1_0: These are the ten pleasure seekers found in the world.

ai-an10:91.22.3_0: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee. And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.
ai-an10:91.22.3_1: And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.
ai-an10:91.23.1_0: In the same way, the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, who makes themselves happy and pleased, and shares it and makes merit, and who uses that wealth untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the ten.”
ai-an10:92.1.1_0: Then he went to the Buddha,
ai-an10:92.1.1_2: While sitting on one side the Fortunate One said this to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika:
ai-an10:92.2.1_0: “Householder, when a noble disciple has quelled five dangers and threats, has the four factors of stream-entry, and has clearly seen and comprehended the noble cycle with wisdom, they may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
ai-an10:92.2.2_0: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm.
ai-an10:92.2.2_1: I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’
ai-an10:92.3.1_0: What are the five dangers and threats they have quelled?
ai-an10:92.3.2_0: Anyone who kills living creatures creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who refrains from killing living creatures creates no dangers and threats either in the present life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an10:92.3.3_0: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who refrains from killing living creatures.
ai-an10:92.4.4_0: Anyone who uses alcoholic drinks that cause negligence creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who refrains from using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence creates no dangers and threats either in the present life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an10:92.4.5_0: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who refrains from using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an10:92.4.6_0: These are the five dangers and threats they have quelled.
ai-an10:92.5.1_0: What are the four factors of stream-entry that they have?
ai-an10:92.5.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha ...
ai-an10:92.5.3_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-an10:92.5.4_0: is endowed with perfect confidence in the Dhamma,
ai-an10:92.5.5_0: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’
ai-an10:92.5.6_0: Here, venerable friends, a noble disciple is endowed with perfect confidence in the Community (thinking):
ai-an10:92.5.7_0: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, direct, methodical, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.’
ai-an10:92.5.8_0: And a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.
ai-an10:92.5.9_0: These are the four factors of stream-entry that they have.
ai-an10:92.6.1_0: And what is the noble cycle that they have clearly seen and comprehended with wisdom?
ai-an10:92.6.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:
ai-an10:92.6.3_0: ‘When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
ai-an10:92.6.4_0: When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
ai-an10:92.6.5_0: ignorance is a condition for choices.
ai-an10:92.6.6_0: with a (volitional) process as condition: consciousness,
ai-an10:92.6.7_0: with consciousness as condition: mind and bodily form,
ai-an10:92.6.8_0: because of mind and body: the six sense spheres,
ai-an10:92.6.9_0: because of the six sense spheres: contact,
ai-an10:92.6.15_0: with birth as condition: old age, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair (all) arise,
ai-an10:92.6.16_0: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
ai-an10:92.6.17_0: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease. When choices cease, consciousness ceases. When consciousness ceases, name and form cease. When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease. When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases. When contact ceases, feeling ceases. When feeling ceases, craving ceases. When craving ceases, grasping ceases. When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases. When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases. When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
ai-an10:92.6.18_0: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.’
ai-an10:92.6.19_0: And the noble cycle that they have clearly seen and comprehended with wisdom:
ai-an10:92.7.1_0: When a noble disciple has quelled five dangers and threats, has the four factors of stream-entry, and has clearly seen and comprehended the noble cycle with wisdom, they may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
ai-an10:92.7.2_0: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm.
ai-an10:92.7.2_1: I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’”
ai-an10:93.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an10:93.1.2_0: Then, Anāthapiṇḍika left Sāvatthī in the middle of the day to see the Buddha.
ai-an10:93.1.4_0: “It’s the wrong time to see the Buddha,
ai-an10:93.1.6_0: And it’s the wrong time to see the esteemed mendicants,
ai-an10:93.1.8_0: Why don’t I go to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths?”
ai-an10:93.2.1_0: Then he went to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths.
ai-an10:93.2.2_0: Now at that time, the wanderers who follow other paths had come together, making an uproar, a dreadful racket as they sat and talked about all kinds of unworthy topics.
ai-an10:93.2.3_0: When those wanderers saw him coming,
ai-an10:93.2.5_0: “Be quiet, good sirs, don’t make a sound.
ai-an10:93.2.6_0: Now, Anāthapiṇḍika, the disciple of the ascetic Gotama, is coming into our monastery,
ai-an10:93.2.7_0: He is included among the white-clothed lay disciples of the ascetic Gotama, who is residing in Sāvatthī.
ai-an10:93.2.8_0: Such venerables like the quiet, are educated to be quiet, and praise the quiet.
ai-an10:93.2.9_0: Hopefully if he sees that our assembly is quiet he’ll see fit to approach.”
ai-an10:93.3.1_0: Then those wanderers who follow other paths fell silent.
ai-an10:93.3.2_0: Then he went to those wanderers who follow other paths,
ai-an10:93.3.2_1: and after going, they exchanged greetings with the wanderers who follow other paths.
ai-an10:93.3.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an10:93.3.4_0: “Tell us, householder, what is the view of the ascetic Gotama?”
ai-an10:93.3.5_0: “Sirs, I don’t know all his views.”
ai-an10:93.4.1_0: “Well then, since it seems you don’t know all the views of the ascetic Gotama,
ai-an10:93.4.2_0: Tell us, householder, what is the view of the monks?”
ai-an10:93.4.3_0: “Sirs, I don’t know all the mendicants’ views.”
ai-an10:93.5.1_0: “Well then, since it seems you don’t know all the views of the ascetic Gotama or of the mendicants,
ai-an10:93.5.2_0: Tell us, householder, what is your view?”
ai-an10:93.5.3_0: “Sirs, it’s not hard for me to explain what my views are.
ai-an10:93.5.4_0: But please, let the venerables explain their own convictions first. Afterwards it won’t be hard for me to explain my views.”
ai-an10:93.6.1_0: When he said this, one of the wanderers said to him,
ai-an10:93.6.2_0: “The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.7.2_0: “The cosmos is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.8.4_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing ...” ...
ai-an10:93.8.5_0: “The soul and the body are different things ...” ...
ai-an10:93.8.7_0: “A Realized One doesn’t exist after death ...” ...
ai-an10:93.8.8_0: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death ...’ ...
ai-an10:93.8.9_0: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.9.1_0: When this was said, Anāthapiṇḍika said this,
ai-an10:93.9.2_0: “Sirs, regarding the venerable who said this:
ai-an10:93.9.3_0: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.9.5_0: This view of his has either arisen from his own improper attention, or is conditioned by what someone else says.
ai-an10:93.9.6_0: But that view is created, conditioned, chosen, dependently originated.
ai-an10:93.9.7_0: Anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.9.9_0: What he clings to and holds to is just suffering.
ai-an10:93.10.1_0: Regarding the venerable who said this:
ai-an10:93.10.2_0: ‘The cosmos is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.10.4_0: This view of his has either arisen from his own improper attention, or is conditioned by what someone else says.
ai-an10:93.10.5_0: But that view is created, conditioned, chosen, dependently originated.
ai-an10:93.10.6_0: Anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.10.8_0: What he clings to and holds to is just suffering.
ai-an10:93.11.1_0: Regarding the venerable who said this:
ai-an10:93.11.4_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing ...” ...
ai-an10:93.11.5_0: “The soul and the body are different things ...” ...
ai-an10:93.11.7_0: “A Realized One doesn’t exist after death ...” ...
ai-an10:93.11.8_0: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death ...’ ...
ai-an10:93.11.9_0: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.
ai-an10:93.11.11_0: This view of his has either arisen from his own improper attention, or is conditioned by what someone else says.
ai-an10:93.11.12_0: But that view is created, conditioned, chosen, dependently originated.
ai-an10:93.11.13_0: Anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.11.15_0: What he clings to and holds to is just suffering.”
ai-an10:93.12.1_0: When he said this the wanderers said to him,
ai-an10:93.12.2_0: “Householder, we’ve each explained our own convictions.
ai-an10:93.12.3_0: Tell us, householder, what is your view?”
ai-an10:93.12.4_0: “Sirs, anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.12.6_0: And what’s suffering is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.
ai-an10:93.13.1_0: “Householder, anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.13.3_0: Whatever you cling to and hold on, householder, is getting caught up in the middle of you.”
ai-an10:93.14.1_0: “Sirs, anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.
ai-an10:93.14.3_0: And I’ve truly seen clearly with right wisdom that what’s suffering is not mine, I am not this, it’s not my self.
ai-an10:93.14.4_0: And I truly understand the escape beyond that.”
ai-an10:93.15.1_0: When this was said, those wanderers sat silent, dismayed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.
ai-an10:93.15.2_0: Seeing this, Anāthapiṇḍika got up from his seat. He went to the Buddha
ai-an10:93.15.2_2: and informed the Buddha of all they had discussed.
ai-an10:93.15.4_0: That’s how you should legitimately and completely refute those foolish men from time to time.”
ai-an10:93.16.1_0: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired the householder Anāthapiṇḍika with a Dhamma talk,
ai-an10:93.16.2_0: after which Anāthapiṇḍika got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha before leaving.
ai-an10:93.17.1_0: Then, not long after Anāthapiṇḍika had left, the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-an10:93.17.2_0: “Mendicants, even a hundred years old, someone who would legitimately and completely refute those wanderers who follow other paths just as the householder Anāthapiṇḍika would.”
ai-an10:94.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā Lotus Pond.
ai-an10:94.1.2_0: Then he went out to see the Buddha in the middle of the day to see the Buddha.
ai-an10:94.1.4_0: “It’s the wrong time to see the Buddha,
ai-an10:94.1.6_0: And it’s the wrong time to see the esteemed mendicants,
ai-an10:94.1.8_0: Why don’t I go to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths?”
ai-an10:94.2.1_0: Then he went to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths.
ai-an10:94.2.2_0: Now at that time, the wanderers who follow other paths had come together, making an uproar, a dreadful racket as they sat and talked about all kinds of unworthy topics.
ai-an10:94.3.1_0: Seeing him coming off in the distance,
ai-an10:94.3.2_0: “Be quiet, good sirs, don’t make a sound.
ai-an10:94.3.3_0: The householder Vajjiyamāhita, a disciple of the ascetic Gotama, is coming into our monastery.
ai-an10:94.3.4_0: He is included among the white-clothed lay disciples of the ascetic Gotama, who is residing near Campā.
ai-an10:94.3.5_0: Such venerables like the quiet, are educated to be quiet, and praise the quiet.
ai-an10:94.3.6_0: Hopefully if he sees that our assembly is quiet he’ll see fit to approach.”
ai-an10:94.4.1_0: Then those wanderers who follow other paths fell silent.
ai-an10:94.4.2_0: Then he went to those wanderers who follow other paths.
ai-an10:94.4.2_1: and after going, they exchanged greetings with the wanderers who follow other paths.
ai-an10:94.4.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an10:94.4.4_0: “Is it really true, householder? Does the ascetic Gotama criticize all forms of mortification? Does he categorically condemn and denounce those self-mortifiers who live rough?”
ai-an10:94.4.5_0: “No, sirs, the ascetic Gotama does not criticize all forms of mortification. Nor does he categorically condemn and denounce those self-mortifiers who live rough.
ai-an10:94.4.6_0: The Buddha criticizes where it is due, and praises where it is due.
ai-an10:94.4.7_0: Gain, sir, the Buddha is praised and displayed.
ai-an10:94.4.8_0: and is not definitive on this point.”
ai-an10:94.5.1_0: When he said this, one of the wanderers said to him,
ai-an10:94.5.2_0: “Hold on, householder! That ascetic Gotama who you praise is an exterminator who refrains from making statements.”
ai-an10:94.5.3_0: “On this point, also, I reasonably respond to the venerables.
ai-an10:94.5.4_0: The Buddha has stated ‘This is skillful’ and
ai-an10:94.5.6_0: So when it comes to what is skillful and unskillful the Buddha makes a statement.
ai-an10:94.5.7_0: He is not accomplished in wisdom.”
ai-an10:94.6.1_0: When this was said, those wanderers sat silent, dismayed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.
ai-an10:94.6.2_0: Seeing this, Vajjiyamāhita got up from his seat. He went to the Buddha
ai-an10:94.6.3_0: and informed the Buddha of all they had discussed.
ai-an10:94.7.2_0: That’s how you should legitimately and completely refute those foolish men from time to time.
ai-an10:94.7.3_0: I don’t say that all mortifications should be undergone.
ai-an10:94.7.4_0: But I don’t say that no mortifications should be undergone.
ai-an10:94.7.5_0: I don’t say that all observances should be undertaken.
ai-an10:94.7.6_0: But I don’t say that no observances should be undertaken.
ai-an10:94.7.7_0: I don’t say that all efforts should be tried.
ai-an10:94.7.8_0: But I don’t say that no efforts should be tried.

ai-an10:99.21.1_0: They act with situational awareness when going out and coming back; when looking ahead and aside; when bending and extending the limbs; when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes; when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting; when urinating and defecating; when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, speaking, and keeping silent.
ai-an10:99.22.1_0: When they have this noble spectrum of ethics, this noble sense restraint, and this noble mindfulness and situational awareness,
ai-an10:99.22.2_0: they frequent a secluded lodging—a wilderness, the root of a tree, a hill, a ravine, a mountain cave, a charnel ground, a forest, the open air, a heap of straw.
ai-an10:99.22.3_0: Gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, he sits down cross-legged, with his body straight, and establishes mindfulness right there.
ai-an10:99.23.1_0: Giving up desire for the world, he meditates with a heart rid of desire, cleansing the mind of desire.
ai-an10:99.23.2_0: Giving up ill will, they meditate with a mind rid of ill will, full of compassion for all living beings, cleansing the mind of ill will and malevolence.
ai-an10:99.23.3_0: Giving up dullness and drowsiness, they meditate with a mind rid of dullness and drowsiness, perceiving light, mindful and aware, cleansing the mind of dullness and drowsiness.
ai-an10:99.23.4_0: Giving up restlessness and remorse, they meditate without restlessness, their mind peaceful inside, cleansing the mind of restlessness and remorse.
ai-an10:99.23.5_0: Giving up doubt, he meditates having gone beyond doubt, not undecided about skillful qualities, cleansing the mind of doubt.
ai-an10:99.24.1_0: They give up these five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom.
ai-an10:99.24.2_0: Then, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, they enter and remain in the first absorption ...
ai-an10:99.24.4_0: Isn’t this state better than what they had before?”
ai-an10:99.25.1_0: “When my disciples see this quality inside themselves they frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest. But so far they haven’t achieved their own goal.
ai-an10:99.26.1_0: Furthermore, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, a mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-an10:99.26.3_0: Isn’t this state better than what they had before?”
ai-an10:99.27.1_0: “When my disciples see this quality inside themselves they frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest. But so far they haven’t achieved their own goal.
ai-an10:99.28.3_0: Isn’t this state better than what they had before?”
ai-an10:99.29.1_0: “When my disciples see this quality inside themselves they frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest. But so far they haven’t achieved their own goal.
ai-an10:99.31.1_0: “Furthermore, going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, a mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-an10:99.31.3_0: Isn’t this state better than what they had before?”
ai-an10:99.32.1_0: “When my disciples see this quality inside themselves they frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest. But so far they haven’t achieved their own goal.
ai-an10:99.33.1_0: Furthermore, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, a mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness. ...” ...
ai-an10:99.34.1_0: “Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness. ...” ...
ai-an10:99.35.1_0: “Going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-an10:99.35.3_0: Isn’t this state better than what they had before?”
ai-an10:99.36.1_0: “When my disciples see this quality inside themselves they frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest. But so far they haven’t achieved their own goal.
ai-an10:99.37.1_0: Furthermore, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, a mendicant enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an10:99.37.1_1: And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
ai-an10:99.37.3_0: Isn’t this state better than what they had before?”
ai-an10:99.38.1_0: “When my disciples see this quality inside themselves they frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest. And they have achieved their own goal.
ai-an10:99.38.2_0: Come on, Upāli, stay with the Saṅgha.
ai-an10:99.38.3_0: If you stay with the Saṅgha you’ll be comfortable.”
ai-an10:100.1.1_0: “Mendicants, without giving up ten things you can’t realize perfection.
ai-an10:100.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:100.1.3_0: Greed, hate, delusion, anger, hostility, disdain, contempt, jealousy, stinginess, and conceit.
ai-an10:100.1.4_0: Without giving up these ten things you can’t realize perfection.
ai-an10:100.2.1_0: After giving up ten things you can realize perfection.
ai-an10:100.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:100.2.3_0: Greed, hate, delusion, anger, hostility, disdain, contempt, jealousy, stinginess, and conceit.
ai-an10:100.2.4_0: After giving up these ten things you can realize perfection.”
ai-an10:100.2.6_0: The fifth sub-chapter on Upāli is finished.
ai-an10:100.3.3_0: What is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods?
ai-an10:100.3.5_0: The second rains residence was completed.
ai-an10:101.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when these three perceptions for ascetics are developed and cultivated they fulfill seven things.
ai-an10:101.1.3_0: ‘I have secured freedom from class.’ ‘My livelihood is tied up with others.’ ‘My behavior should be different.’
ai-an10:101.1.4_0: When these three perceptions for ascetics are developed and cultivated they fulfill seven things.
ai-an10:101.2.1_0: What are the teachings grouped by seven?
ai-an10:101.2.2_0: Their deeds and behavior are always consistent with the precepts. They’re content, kind-hearted, and humble. They want to train. They use the necessities of life after reflecting on their purpose. They’re energetic.
ai-an10:101.2.3_0: When those three perceptions for ascetics are developed and cultivated they fulfill these seven things.”
ai-an10:102.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated they fulfill three knowledges.
ai-an10:102.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by seven?
ai-an10:102.1.3_0: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.
ai-an10:102.1.4_0: When these seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated they fulfill three knowledges.
ai-an10:102.1.6_0: It’s when a mendicant recollects their many kinds of past lives.
ai-an10:102.1.7_1: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-an10:102.1.8_0: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-an10:102.1.9_0: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an10:102.1.10_0: When those seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated they fulfill these three knowledges.”
ai-an10:103.1.1_0: “Mendicants, relying on the wrong way leads to failure, not success.
ai-an10:103.1.2_0: And how does relying on the wrong way lead to failure, not success?
ai-an10:103.1.3_0: Wrong view gives rise to wrong thought. Wrong thought gives rise to wrong speech. Wrong speech gives rise to wrong action. Wrong action gives rise to wrong livelihood. Wrong livelihood gives rise to wrong effort. Wrong effort gives rise to wrong mindfulness. Wrong mindfulness gives rise to wrong immersion. Wrong immersion gives rise to wrong knowledge. Wrong knowledge gives rise to wrong freedom.
ai-an10:103.1.4_0: That’s how relying on the wrong way leads to failure, not success.
ai-an10:103.2.1_0: Relying on the right way leads to success, not failure.
ai-an10:103.2.2_0: And how does relying on the right way lead to success, not failure?
ai-an10:103.2.3_0: Right view gives rise to right thought. Right thought gives rise to right speech. Right speech gives rise to right action. Right action gives rise to right livelihood. Right livelihood gives rise to right effort. Right effort gives rise to right mindfulness. Right mindfulness gives rise to right immersion. Right immersion gives rise to right knowledge. Right knowledge gives rise to right freedom.
ai-an10:103.2.4_0: That’s how relying on the right way leads to success, not failure.”
ai-an10:104.1.1_0: “Mendicants, consider a person who has wrong view, thought, speech, action, livelihood, effort, mindfulness, immersion, knowledge, and freedom.
ai-an10:104.1.2_0: Whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view, their intentions, aims, wishes, and choices all lead to what is unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable, harmful, and suffering.
ai-an10:104.2.1_0: Suppose a seed of neem, angled gourd, or bitter gourd was planted in moist earth. Whatever nutrients it takes up from the earth and water would lead to its bitter, acerbic, and unpleasant taste.
ai-an10:104.2.4_0: In the same way, consider a person who has wrong view, thought, speech, action, livelihood, effort, mindfulness, immersion, knowledge, and freedom.
ai-an10:104.2.5_0: Whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view, their intentions, aims, wishes, and choices all lead to what is unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable, harmful, and suffering.
ai-an10:104.3.1_0: Consider a person who has right view, thought, speech, action, livelihood, effort, mindfulness, immersion, knowledge, and freedom. Whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view, their intentions, aims, wishes, and choices all lead to what is likable, desirable, agreeable, beneficial, and pleasant.
ai-an10:104.4.1_0: Suppose a seed of sugar cane, fine rice, or grape was planted in moist earth. Whatever nutrients it takes up from the earth and water would lead to its sweet, pleasant, and delicious taste.
ai-an10:104.4.4_0: In the same way, right view ...
ai-an10:104.4.4_1: For one of right freedom, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are undertaken.
ai-an10:104.4.5_0: Whatever bodily, verbal, or mental deeds they undertake in line with that view, their intentions, aims, wishes, and choices all lead to what is likable, desirable, agreeable, beneficial, and pleasant.
ai-an10:105.1.1_0: “Mendicants, ignorance precedes the attainment of unskillful qualities, with lack of conscience and prudence following along.
ai-an10:105.1.2_0: An ignoramus, sunk in ignorance, gives rise to wrong view. Wrong view gives rise to wrong thought. Wrong thought gives rise to wrong speech. Wrong speech gives rise to wrong action. Wrong action gives rise to wrong livelihood. Wrong livelihood gives rise to wrong effort. Wrong effort gives rise to wrong mindfulness. Wrong mindfulness gives rise to wrong immersion. Wrong immersion gives rise to wrong knowledge. Wrong knowledge gives rise to wrong freedom.
ai-an10:105.2.1_0: Knowledge precedes the attainment of skillful qualities, with conscience and prudence following along.
ai-an10:105.2.2_0: A sage, firm in knowledge, gives rise to right view. Right view gives rise to right thought. Right thought gives rise to right speech. Right speech gives rise to right action. Right action gives rise to right livelihood. Right livelihood gives rise to right effort. Right effort gives rise to right mindfulness. Right mindfulness gives rise to right immersion. Right immersion gives rise to right knowledge. Right knowledge gives rise to right freedom.”
ai-an10:106.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these ten grounds for wearing away.

ai-an10:106.1.4_0: And the many bad, unskillful qualities that arise because of wrong view are worn away.
ai-an10:106.1.5_0: And because of right view, many skillful qualities are fully developed.

ai-an10:106.11.1_0: These are the ten grounds for wearing away.”

ai-an10:107.1.1_0: “There is, monks, a gift to one worthy of a religious donation:
ai-an10:107.1.2_0: They have food, drink, snacks, meals, refreshments, and beverages, as well as dancing, singing, and music.
ai-an10:107.1.3_0: There is such wash, I don’t deny it.
ai-an10:107.1.4_0: That washing is low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. It doesn’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-an10:107.2.1_0: I will teach a noble washing that leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment. Relying on that washing, sentient beings who are liable to rebirth, old age, and death, to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress are freed from all these things.
ai-an10:107.2.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

ai-an10:108.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if they give a disciplination, it’s the right way to get rid of resentment for the bile, phlegm, and for warding off of illness and to promote good health.
ai-an10:108.1.2_0: There is such a purgative, I don’t deny it.
ai-an10:108.1.3_0: But this kind of purgative sometimes works and sometimes fails.
ai-an10:108.2.1_0: I will teach a noble purgative that works without fail. Relying on that purgative, sentient beings who are liable to rebirth, old age, and death, to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress are freed from all these things.
ai-an10:108.2.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

ai-an10:108.4.2_0: And the many bad, unskillful qualities produced by wrong view are purged.

ai-an10:111.1.1_0: Then a certain monk went to the Fortunate One,
ai-an10:111.2.1_0: “Sir, they speak of this person called ‘an adept’.
ai-an10:111.2.2_0: How is an adept mendicant defined?”
ai-an10:111.2.3_0: “Mendicant, it’s when a mendicant has an adept’s right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.
ai-an10:111.2.4_0: That’s how a mendicant is an adept.”
ai-an10:112.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ten qualities of an adept.
ai-an10:112.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-an10:112.1.3_0: An adept's right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.
ai-an10:112.1.4_0: These are the ten qualities of an adept.”
ai-an10:112.1.6_0: The first sub-chapter on perceptions is finished.
ai-an10:112.2.4_0: Two on the hearts of the two;
ai-an10:113.1.1_0: “Mendicants, you should know bad principles with bad results.
ai-an10:113.1.2_0: And you should know good principles with good results.
ai-an10:113.1.3_0: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.
ai-an10:113.2.1_0: And what are bad principles with bad results?
ai-an10:113.2.2_0: Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.
ai-an10:113.2.3_0: This is called bad principles with bad results.
ai-an10:113.3.1_0: And what are good principles with good results?
ai-an10:113.3.2_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.
ai-an10:113.3.3_0: This is called the principle and the good principle.
ai-an10:113.4.1_0: ‘You should know bad principles with bad results.
ai-an10:113.4.2_0: And you should know good principles with good results.
ai-an10:113.4.3_0: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.’
ai-an10:113.4.4_0: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.”
ai-an10:114.1.1_0: “Mendicants, you should know bad principles and good principles.
ai-an10:114.1.3_0: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.
ai-an10:114.2.1_0: So what are bad principles? What are good principles? What are bad results? And what are good results?
ai-an10:114.3.1_0: Wrong view is a bad principle.

ai-an10:119.1.1_0: Now, at that time it was the sabbath. The brahmin Jāṇussoṇi had bathed his head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes. Holding a handful of fresh grass, he stood to one side not far from the Buddha.

ai-an10:119.2.5_0: “Master Gotama, today is the ceremony of descent for the brahmin clan.”

ai-an10:119.3.2_0: “Well, Master Gotama, on the sabbath the brahmins bathe their heads and dress in a new pair of linen robes. They make a heap of fresh cow dung and spread it with green grass. Then they make their beds between the boundary and the fire chamber.

ai-an10:119.3.5_0: And they serve the fire with abundant ghee, oil, and butter.
ai-an10:119.3.6_0: And when the night has passed they serve the brahmins with a variety of delicious foods.
ai-an10:119.3.7_0: That’s how the brahmins observe the ceremony of descent.”

ai-an10:167.1.1_0: Now, at that time it was the sabbath. The brahmin Jāṇussoṇi had bathed his head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes. Holding a handful of fresh grass, he stood to one side not far from the Buddha.
ai-an10:167.2.3_0: “Brahmin, why have you bathed your head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes? Why are you standing to one side holding a handful of fresh grass?
ai-an10:167.2.4_0: What’s going on today with the brahmin clan?”
ai-an10:167.2.5_0: “Master Gotama, today is the ceremony of descent for the brahmin clan.”
ai-an10:167.3.1_0: “But brahmin, how is the ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins?”
ai-an10:167.3.2_0: “Well, Master Gotama, on the sabbath the brahmins bathe their heads and dress in a new pair of linen robes. They make a heap of fresh cow dung and spread it with green grass. Then they make their beds between the boundary and the fire chamber.
ai-an10:167.3.3_0: That night they rise three times and worship the fire with joined palms:
ai-an10:167.3.5_0: And they serve the fire with abundant ghee, oil, and butter.
ai-an10:167.3.6_0: And when the night has passed they serve the brahmins with a variety of delicious foods.
ai-an10:167.3.7_0: That’s how the brahmins observe the ceremony of descent.”
ai-an10:167.4.1_0: “The ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is quite different from that observed in the training of the Noble One.”
ai-an10:167.4.2_0: “But Master Gotama, how is the ceremony of descent observed in the training of the Noble One?
ai-an10:167.4.3_0: Master Gotama, please teach me this.”
ai-an10:167.5.1_0: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an10:167.6.2_0: ‘Killing living creatures has a bad result in the present life and in lives to come.’
ai-an10:167.6.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up killing living creatures,
ai-an10:167.6.4_0: they descend from killing living creatures.
ai-an10:167.7.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:167.7.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up stealing,
ai-an10:167.8.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:167.8.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up sexual misconduct,
ai-an10:167.9.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:167.9.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up lying,
ai-an10:167.10.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:167.10.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up divisive speech,
ai-an10:167.11.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:167.11.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up harsh speech,
ai-an10:167.12.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:167.12.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up talking nonsense,
ai-an10:167.13.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:167.13.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up covetousness,
ai-an10:167.14.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:167.14.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up ill will,
ai-an10:167.15.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:167.15.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong view,
ai-an10:167.15.5_0: This is the ceremony of descent in the training of the Noble One.”
ai-an10:167.16.1_0: “The ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is quite different from that observed in the training of the Noble One.
ai-an10:167.16.2_0: And, Master Gotama, the ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is not worth a sixteenth part of the ceremony of descent observed in the training of the Noble One.
ai-an10:167.16.4_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an10:168.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you the noble descent.
ai-an10:168.1.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an10:168.2.1_0: “And what, mendicants, is the noble descent?
ai-an10:168.2.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:
ai-an10:168.2.3_0: ‘Killing living creatures has a bad result
ai-an10:168.2.4_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:168.2.5_0: Reflecting like this, they give up killing living creatures,
ai-an10:168.2.6_0: they descend from killing living creatures.
ai-an10:168.3.2_0: in both this life and the next.’
ai-an10:168.3.3_0: Reflecting like this, they give up stealing,
ai-an10:168.11.1_0: ‘Wrong view has a bad result in the present life and in lives to come.’
ai-an10:168.11.2_0: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong view,
ai-an10:168.11.4_0: This is called the noble descent.”
ai-an10:169.1.1_0: Then Saṅgārava the brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an10:169.1.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an10:169.2.1_0: “Master Gotama, what is the near shore? And what is the far shore?”
ai-an10:169.2.2_0: “Killing living creatures is the near shore, brahmin, and not killing living creatures is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.3_0: Stealing is the near shore, and not stealing is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.4_0: Sexual misconduct is the near shore, and avoiding sexual misconduct is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.5_0: Lying is the near shore, and avoiding lying is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.6_0: Divisive speech is the near shore, and avoiding divisive speech is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.7_0: Harsh speech is the near shore, and avoiding harsh speech is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.8_0: Talking nonsense is the near shore, and avoiding talking nonsense is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.9_0: Covetousness is the near shore, and contentment is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.10_0: Ill will is the near shore, and good will is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.11_0: Wrong view is the near shore, and right view is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.2.12_0: This is the near shore, and this is the far shore.
ai-an10:169.3.2_0: ask what’s beyond the domain of Death.
ai-an10:169.4.1_0: When the teaching is well explained,
ai-an10:169.4.4_0: Death’s domain so hard to pass.
ai-an10:169.5.1_0: Having given up the dark state,
ai-an10:169.5.2_0: A astute person should develop it.
ai-an10:169.6.3_0: With no possessions, an astute person
ai-an10:169.6.4_0: should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
ai-an10:169.7.1_0: Those whose minds are rightly developed
ai-an10:169.7.6_0: they in this world are quenched.”

ai-an10:176.15.1_0: They have ill will and malicious intentions:

ai-an10:176.29.2_7: Not for the sake of his self, or for the sake of another or for the sake of a trifling material gain,
ai-an10:176.30.1_1: He doesn’t repeat in one place what he heard in another so as to divide people against each other. Instead, he reconciles those who are divided, supporting unity, delighting in harmony, loving harmony, speaking words that promote harmony.
ai-an10:176.31.1_1: They speak in a way that’s mellow, pleasing to the ear, lovely, going to the heart, polite, likable and agreeable to the people.
ai-an10:176.32.1_0: They give up talking nonsense. Their words are timely, true, and meaningful, in line with the teaching and training.
ai-an10:176.32.2_0: They say things at the right time which are valuable, reasonable, succinct, and beneficial.
ai-an10:176.33.1_0: This is the fourfold purity by way of speech.
ai-an10:176.34.1_0: And how is purity threefold by way of mind?
ai-an10:176.34.2_0: It’s when a certain person is content.
ai-an10:176.34.2_1: Whatever wealth and provisions belong to another, he is not avaracious for that, (thinking):
ai-an10:176.34.2_2: ‘Oh, if only their belongings were mine!’
ai-an10:176.35.1_0: They have a kind heart and loving intentions:
ai-an10:176.35.1_1: ‘May these sentient beings live free of enmity and ill will, untroubled and happy!’
ai-an10:176.36.2_0: ‘There is meaning in giving, sacrifice, and offerings. There are fruits and results of good and bad deeds. There is an afterlife. There are duties to mother and father. There are beings reborn spontaneously. And there are ascetics and brahmins who are well attained and practiced, and who describe the afterlife after realizing it with their own insight.’
ai-an10:176.37.1_0: This is the threefold purity by way of mind.
ai-an10:176.38.1_0: These are the ten ways of doing skillful deeds.
ai-an10:176.38.2_0: When you have these ten ways of doing skillful deeds, then if you rise early, whether or not you stroke the earth from your bed, you’re still pure.
ai-an10:176.38.2_1: Even if you don’t stroke the earth, you’re still pure.
ai-an10:176.39.1_0: Whether or not you stroke fresh cow dung, you’re still pure.
ai-an10:176.40.1_0: Whether or not you stroke green grass, you’re still pure.
ai-an10:176.41.1_0: Whether or not you serve the sacred flame, you’re still pure.
ai-an10:176.42.1_0: Whether or not you revere the sun with joined palms, you’re still pure.
ai-an10:176.43.1_0: Whether or not you immerse yourself in water three times, you’re still pure.
ai-an10:176.43.1_1: Whether or not you immerse yourself in water three times,
ai-an10:176.43.3_0: These ten ways of doing skillful deeds are pure and make things pure.
ai-an10:176.44.1_0: It’s because of those who do these ten kinds of skillful deeds that gods, humans, or any other good places are found.”
ai-an10:176.45.1_0: When he said this, Cunda the smith said to the Buddha,
ai-an10:176.45.3_0: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an10:177.1.1_0: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an10:177.1.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an10:177.2.2_0: give gifts and perform memorial rites for the dead:
ai-an10:177.2.3_0: ‘May this gift aid my departed relatives and family. May they partake of this gift.’
ai-an10:177.2.4_0: But does this gift really aid departed relatives and family?
ai-an10:177.2.5_0: Do they actually partake of it?”
ai-an10:177.2.6_0: “It aids them if the conditions are right, brahmin, but not if the conditions are wrong.”
ai-an10:177.3.1_0: “Then, Master Gotama, what are the right and wrong conditions?”
ai-an10:177.3.2_0: “Brahmin, take someone who kills living creatures, steals, and commits sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re covetous, malicious, with wrong view.
ai-an10:177.3.3_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in hell.
ai-an10:177.3.4_0: There they survive feeding on the food of the hell beings.
ai-an10:177.3.5_0: The conditions there too are wrong, so the gift does not aid the one who lives there.
ai-an10:177.4.1_0: Take someone else who kills living creatures ... and has wrong view.
ai-an10:177.4.2_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the animal realm.
ai-an10:177.4.3_0: There they survive feeding on the animal realm.
ai-an10:177.4.4_0: The conditions there too are wrong, so the gift does not aid the one who lives there.
ai-an10:177.5.1_0: Take someone else who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. They're contented, kind-hearted, and have right view.
ai-an10:177.5.2_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the human realm.
ai-an10:177.5.3_0: There they survive feeding on human food.
ai-an10:177.5.4_0: The conditions there too are wrong, so the gift does not aid the one who lives there.
ai-an10:177.6.1_0: Take someone else who doesn’t kill living creatures ... and has right view.
ai-an10:177.6.2_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods.
ai-an10:177.6.3_0: There they survive feeding on the gods.
ai-an10:177.6.4_0: The conditions there too are wrong, so the gift does not aid the one who lives there.
ai-an10:177.7.1_0: Take someone else who kills living creatures ... and has wrong view.
ai-an10:177.7.2_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the ghost realm.
ai-an10:177.7.3_0: There they survive feeding on the food of the beings in the ghost realm. Or else they survive feeding on what friends and colleagues, relatives and kin provide them with from here.
ai-an10:177.7.4_0: This is the thing that gift.”
ai-an10:177.8.1_0: “But Master Gotama, who partakes of that gift if the departed relative is not reborn in that place?”
ai-an10:177.8.2_0: “Other departed relatives reborn there will partake of that gift.”
ai-an10:177.9.1_0: “But who partakes of the gift when neither that relative nor other relatives have been reborn in that place?”
ai-an10:177.9.2_0: “It’s impossible, brahmin, it cannot happen that that place is vacant of departed relatives in all this long time.
ai-an10:177.9.3_0: It’s never fruitless for the donor.”
ai-an10:177.10.1_0: “Does Master Gotama propose this even when the conditions are wrong?”
ai-an10:177.10.2_0: “I propose this even when the conditions are wrong.
ai-an10:177.10.3_0: It’s when someone kills living creatures, steals, and commits sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re covetous, malicious, with wrong view.
ai-an10:177.10.4_0: They give to ascetics or brahmins ...
ai-an10:177.10.5_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of elephants.
ai-an10:177.10.6_0: There they get to have food and drink, garlands and various adornments.
ai-an10:177.11.1_0: Since in this life they killed living creatures ... and had wrong view, they were reborn in the company of elephants.
ai-an10:177.11.2_0: Since they gave to ascetics or brahmins ... they get to have food and drink, garlands and various adornments.
ai-an10:177.12.1_0: Take someone else who kills living creatures ... and has wrong view.
ai-an10:177.12.2_0: They give to ascetics or brahmins ...
ai-an10:177.12.3_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of horses. ...
ai-an10:177.12.6_0: There they get to have food and drink, garlands and various adornments.
ai-an10:177.13.1_0: Since in this life they killed living creatures ...
ai-an10:177.13.1_1: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of dogs.
ai-an10:177.13.2_0: Since they gave to ascetics or brahmins ... they get to have food and drink, garlands and various adornments.
ai-an10:177.14.1_0: Take someone else who doesn’t kill living creatures ... and has right view.
ai-an10:177.14.2_0: They give to ascetics or brahmins ...
ai-an10:177.14.3_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the human realm.
ai-an10:177.14.4_0: There they get to have the five kinds of human sensual stimulation.
ai-an10:177.15.1_0: Since in this life they don’t kill living creatures ...
ai-an10:177.15.1_1: who has right view, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the human realm.
ai-an10:177.15.2_0: Since they gave to ascetics or brahmins ... they get to have the five kinds of human sensual stimulation.
ai-an10:177.16.1_0: Take someone else who doesn’t kill living creatures ... and has right view.
ai-an10:177.16.2_0: They give to ascetics or brahmins ...
ai-an10:177.16.3_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods.
ai-an10:177.16.4_0: There they get to have the five kinds of heavenly sensual stimulation.
ai-an10:177.17.1_0: Since in this life they don’t kill living creatures ...
ai-an10:177.17.1_1: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods.
ai-an10:177.17.2_0: Since they gave to ascetics or brahmins ... they get to have the five kinds of heavenly sensual stimulation.
ai-an10:177.17.3_0: It’s never fruitless for the donor.”
ai-an10:177.18.1_0: He said, “It’s incredible, Master Gotama, it’s amazing!
ai-an10:177.18.2_0: Just this much is quite enough to justify giving gifts and performing memorial rites for the dead, since it’s never fruitless for the donor.”
ai-an10:177.18.3_0: “That’s so true, brahmin. It’s never fruitless for the donor.”
ai-an10:177.19.2_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an10:177.19.4_0: The second sub-chapter on Jāṇussoṇi is finished.
ai-an10:178.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you what is good and what is not good.
ai-an10:178.1.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an10:178.2.2_0: Killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct; speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; and covetousness, ill will, and wrong view.
ai-an10:178.2.3_0: This is called what is not good.
ai-an10:178.3.2_0: Avoiding killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct; avoiding speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; contentment, good will, and right view.
ai-an10:178.3.3_0: This is called what is good.”
ai-an10:179.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you the teaching of the noble ones, and what is not the teaching of the noble ones.

ai-an10:199-210.1.4_0: You should not associate with a person who has these ten qualities.”
